argument.name: Width
argument.description: Numeric. The width of the tab band. An integer value. Can be expressed as characters, or inches. To express the width in inches use a quote character. e.g. 5"

argument.name: Height
argument.description: Numeric. The height of the tab band. Can be expresses as a number representing 'lines' or can be expressed in inches. To express the height in inches use a quote character. e.g. .25"

argument.name: Pointer
argument.description: The name of the pointer variable containing the tab meta control definition.

page.description: The {TabBand} command inserts a line of tabs into an Xdialog control. Each tab will display a different page.

case.title: .events.init
case.description: The event fired on initial display.

case.title: .events.change
case.description: The event fired on change (mouse down).

case.title: .events.close
case.description: The event fired when the close button is pressed.

case.title: .events.rClick
case.description: The event fired when a tab is right clicked.

case.title: .events.CompleteChange
case.description: The event fired after the tab change (on mouse up). The meta control gains focus on this event, so if you want to set focus to another control on the Xdialog, then you do it here.

case.title: .LeftPadding
case.description: Numeric. Left indent. Increasing this number pushes the start position of the first tab over to the right.

case.title: .PrevTab
case.description: Numeric. The number of the previous tab.

case.title: .Tab
case.description: Numeric. The number of the current tab.

case.title: .object.SetDirty()
case.description: Sets the dirty state of a tab.
